 Do you think before you speak? Apparently not. Animals, other than sheep, can not interbreed with humans. Dogs can not produce offspring with humans, either can cows, horses, pigs, snakes, eels or anything else. Sheep however can. That is the only animal known besides some primates that can produce offspring with humans, though most don't last through gestation. Honestly...think before you speak. As for it being animal cruelty... ask the dog the next time he tries to hump your leg if its cruelty. Most of those animals are more than willing to do what they are doing.  And yes animals do have rights. They have the right for proper living conditions, shelter, good food, clean water, proper housing and treatment.
 
 
how do you know if an animal has a behavorial disorder? it's impossible to tell.

 It is not impossible to tell if an animal has behavioral disorders. Its called Behaviorism. Behavior disorders such as aggression, fear biting, excessive hyperactivity and a handful of others can be pointed out by a behavioral expert.
